children.name: Useful in verification of probabilistic systems!
keywords: Useful in verification of probabilistic systems!
CoBüchi automata with properties A. and B. are 0-1-probabilistic.
History-deterministic (HD) coBüchi automata admit minimal, canonical automata, constructible in PTIME.

children.name: An alternating automaton is history-deterministic if both players have on-the-fly strategies in these games.

children.name: thm coBuchi alternating
keywords: The minimal HD non-deterministic coBüchi automaton is also minimal amongst all HD alternating (co)Büchi automata.

children.name: Layered automata
Definition
keywords: A sequence of deterministic transition systems with morphisms

children.name: Transitions: given by the deepest where the transition exists
keywords: Transitions: given by the deepest where the transition exists

children.name: Properties
All layered automata are history deterministic and 0-1 probabilistic.
keywords: All layered automata are history deterministic and 0-1 probabilistic.

children.name: Each ω-regular language admits a canonical minimal layered automaton.
keywords: Each ω-regular language admits a canonical minimal layered automaton.
It can be computed in PTIME.

children.name: Congruence-based characterisation of the minimal layered automaton.
keywords: Congruence-based characterisation of the minimal layered automaton.
Deterministic and minimal HD coBüchi automata are layered.
Formalism to represent a subclass of alternating parity automata

children.name: Conclusions
Recently, other canonical representations of ω-regular languages have been introduced:
keywords: Recently, other canonical representations of ω-regular languages have been introduced:
Layered automata admit canonical, minimal automata, computable in polynomial time

children.name: Conclusions 2
Passive and active learning of layered automata
keywords: Passive and active learning of layered automata

children.name: Implementation, boolean operations, translations from logic...
keywords: Implementation, boolean operations, translations from logic...
The minimal layered automaton has a minimal number of states among all equivalent HD alternating parity automata.
Joint work with: Christof Löding and Igor Walukiewicz
Layered Automata A canonical model for ω-regular languages
